name: Choc-Oat Chip Cookies
description: Brought to the Serious Eats Cookie Swap 2009 by Serious Eats intern alum Gordon Mark. Adapted from the back of a Quaker Oats package....
recipeIngredient: 1 cup (2 sticks) margarine or butter, softened

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F. Beat together margarine and sugars until creamy. Add eggs, milk and vanilla; heat well.
Add combined flour, baking soda and salt; mix well. Stir in oats, chocolate chips and nuts; mix well.

Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 9 to 10 minutes for a chewy cookie or 12 to 13 minutes for a crisp cookie. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store in tightly covered container.
